name: BRIGHT AND VARICK URBAN RENEWAL COMPANY, LLC, Plaintiff-Respondent, v. JERSEY CITY PLANNING BOARD, Jersey City Zoning Board of Adjustment, the Mayor and Council of the City of Jersey City, Robert Byrne, in His Official Capacity as City Clerk, Anthony Cruz, in His Official Capacity as Director, Housing Economic Development and Commerce and City of Jersey City, Defendants. Van Vorst Park Association, Inc., Intervener-Petitioner.
name_abbreviation: Bright & Varick Urban Renewal Co. v. Jersey City Planning Bd.

court.name: New Jersey Court of Errors and Appeals

parties:
BRIGHT AND VARICK URBAN RENEWAL COMPANY, LLC, Plaintiff-Respondent,
v.
JERSEY CITY PLANNING BOARD, Jersey City Zoning Board of Adjustment, the Mayor and Council of the City of Jersey City, Robert Byrne, in His Official Capacity as City Clerk, Anthony Cruz, in His Official Capacity as Director, Housing Economic Development and Commerce and City of Jersey City, Defendants.
attorneys: A petition for certification of the judgment in A-002040-14 having been submitted to this Court, and the Court having considered the same;
It is ORDERED that the petition for certification is denied, with costs.
casebody.head_matter:
BRIGHT AND VARICK URBAN RENEWAL COMPANY, LLC, Plaintiff-Respondent,
v.
JERSEY CITY PLANNING BOARD, Jersey City Zoning Board of Adjustment, the Mayor and Council of the City of Jersey City, Robert Byrne, in His Official Capacity as City Clerk, Anthony Cruz, in His Official Capacity as Director, Housing Economic Development and Commerce and City of Jersey City, Defendants.
Van Vorst Park Association, Inc., Intervener-Petitioner.
C-401 September Term 2017
079679
Supreme Court of New Jersey.
December 8, 2017
To the Appellate Division, Superior Court:
A petition for certification of the judgment in A-002040-14 having been submitted to this Court, and the Court having considered the same;
It is ORDERED that the petition for certification is denied, with costs.
